description: This course will introduce students to the theoretical and methodological concepts and approaches
needed for a sociological (and social scientific) understanding of music, organized loosely
around issues of production, content, and reception, but also providing (and borrowing)
insight from major sociological topics like culture, organizations and institutions, social
networks, race, class, gender, sexuality, and politics.  We will also draw on history, anthropology,
